body:
Sorry for my poor english ;)
I try to restore a backup from Hubic. A big file :o( 25Go 
But rclone copy command always failed with an unexpected EOF.
The problem come surely from the connection to Hubic. The error happened randomly, and when rclone retry, it tells that sizes differ and so it start from beginning. 
Is there any option to resume the copy from size already downloaded ?
Thank you very much.

issue.title: Download restart on "connection reset by peer"

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I am downloading large files (greater than 200GB each) from Ceph storage. I constantly see these failure after 100GB in -->
`Removing partially written file on error: read tcp 10.242.67.49:54860->155.101.11.35:443: read: connection reset by peer`

This seems like an obvious place where the download should be automatically resumed rather than deleting the file and starting all over as it currently does.

body:
I have the same problem, when I download large files, it always fail with `Removing partially written file on error: read tcp 192.168.123.75:46742->13.107.136.9:443: i/o timeout`. then it redownload, then fail again...
OneDrive
@chenxuuu this issue would fix your problem I think.  Just need to implement it!

issue.title: chunk/split large files?

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
so I figure this might be out of scope for rclone, but figured I'd ask anyways.  Now that rclone is working for me with acd I can't maintain network connections for really large files.

might it be possible to add a file chunking to rclone (so that I can mark one of the repos as chunked so large files are written in small file chunks to a chunked destination, but converted to a whole if copied to a non chunked destination.

this way even for sites that don't support resemble uploads, one can have effective support for it.

<edited for a little clarity>

body: +1 I also stumbled upon a scenario where this feature would be extremely useful and save me a lot of time and bandwidth.

now I use `--dry-run` to get list of my files
then use https://github.com/cnbeining/onedrivecmd/ with `-hack` option (download with aria2) to solve this problem now....
yeah... aria2 is faster

issue.title: Fail to copy 1TB file from B2 to S3

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Error copying or syncing from B2 to S3



#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.45
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.11


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Win 10 64 bit


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Backblaze B2 to AWS S3


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone sync -vv b2:VeeamOffsiteBackup\CBB_Veeam\F:\B2D\B2Cloud\B2Cloud-1-CritTest\B2Cloud-1-CritTestD2018-12-11T113029.vbk:\20181212034601\B2Cloud-1-CritTestD2018-12-11T113029.vbk aws:critbucket

body: I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.47
